steps.title: Use a gentle nail file when you shape your nails.
steps.content: Use a gentle nail file when you shape your nails. Feel both sides of your nail file and use the finer, gentler side when you rub it against your nails. If you use the more abrasive side on your thin nails, you'll cause them to tear or peel. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Never file your nails when they're wet since you can damage them.

steps.title: Don't file down the ridges of your nail plate.
steps.content: Don't file down the ridges of your nail plate. Your nail is made up of 30 microscopic layers, but filing down the top of your nail can remove 10% of the nail. This is why it's important to leave the ridges and top of your nail intact. [2] X Research source Removing the top layer of your nail plate can weaken the nail, which will cause peeling and damage.

steps.title: Wear gloves if you'll be submerging your hands in water.
steps.content: Wear gloves if you'll be submerging your hands in water. When water soaks deep into your nails, it can cause the ends to split or crack, especially if your nails are already thin. Wear gloves when you'll be washing dishes or try to limit the amount of time you keep your fingers in water. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, instead of soaking in the bathtub when you bathe, take a quick shower instead. You should also wear gloves to protect your nails when you dig or use cleaning supplies.

steps.title: Use non-acetone nail polish remover to take polish off.
steps.content: Use non-acetone nail polish remover to take polish off. When you're taking off your nail polish, dip a cotton ball or cotton bad in a non-acetone nail polish remover and wipe it over your nail. Non-acetone nail polish removers aren't as harsh as acetone nail polish removers, and they usually have moisturizing ingredients, such as glycerin or panthenol, which prevent your nails from drying and peeling. [4] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Don't ever pick nail polish off of your nails since you'll also remove the top layer of the nail plate. This can thin your nails and take months to grow back.

steps.title: Oil your nails to protect them from moisture damage.
steps.content: Oil your nails to protect them from moisture damage. If you frequently get your nails wet or wash your hands a lot, spread cuticle or nail oil over your nails. Then, massage the oil into your fingernails so they absorb the oil. This helps create a barrier against water, which can cause your nails to split or crack. [5] X Expert Source Mia Rubie Nail Artist Expert Interview. 23 April 2020. Completely wipe away nail oil before you apply nail polish or a nail strengthening product.

steps.title: Apply nail polish to add temporary thickness and strength.
steps.content: Apply nail polish to add temporary thickness and strength. If you're looking to quickly thicken your weak nails, brush on at least 2 or 3 layers of nail polish. Remember to let the polish dry thoroughly between each coat. The nail polish acts like an additional layer that sits on top of your nail. [6] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Don't leave your nail polish on for more than a week or two since it will begin to dry out your nails.

steps.title: Brush a clear nail strengthening product on your nails every day.
steps.content: Brush a clear nail strengthening product on your nails every day. It will take time for your nails to become thicker, but nail strengthening products are designed to build up your nails over time. Most strengthening products contain the protein keratin, vitamins, and moisturizers that are great for your nails. [7] X Research source Follow the manufacturer's instructions. Most products will advise you to apply a coat to your nails every day for a set amount of time. Then, you'll need to remove the product.

steps.title: Take a nail supplement that contains vitamins and biotin.
steps.content: Take a nail supplement that contains vitamins and biotin. You can find supplements designed to strengthen and thicken nails at most grocery stores, pharmacies, and online. They usually contain biotin, vitamins A, D, E, and iron. A supplement is a great option if it's difficult to eat a diet that contains these nutrients. [8] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source It may take several weeks or months of taking the supplement before you notice a change in your nails. A collagen supplement may help strengthen your nails as well. [9] X Expert Source Mia Rubie Nail Artist Expert Interview. 23 April 2020.

steps.title: Eat healthy fats, protein, and calcium every day to strengthen your nails.
steps.content: Eat healthy fats, protein, and calcium every day to strengthen your nails. Your nails might be thin or weak if you're not getting a balanced diet. Since nails are made of keratin, a type of protein, eating more protein can help thicken your nails. Healthy fats, such as omega 3s from nuts, and calcium are also important for strong, thick nails. [10] X Research source Try eating chicken, turkey, lean red meat, seafood. If you're vegetarian, quinoa, nuts, and soy are good protein sources.

steps.title: Give yourself time.
steps.content: Give yourself time. Unfortunately, nails take about 6 months to fully grow out, so it will take several weeks or months before you notice any thickening of your nails. Stick with the changes that you're making, such as protecting your nails, taking a supplement, and eating a nutritious diet. Over time, your nails should become healthier and stronger.
